text: {U}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life and reveals his or her hand.

Flying

text: {X}, {T}: Target opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until an artifact card or X cards are revealed, whichever comes first. Flying

"Their thoughts flow through my mind, and I am healed."

Flying

text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Look at the top two cards of target opponent's library, then exile one of them.

editions.flavor: "Once the brew gets the brains nice and pickled, they're a lot easier to pick through."

text:

Whenever a player casts a spell that shares a color or converted mana cost with the exiled card, Thought Prison deals 2 damage to that player.

name: Thought Reflection
text: If you would draw a card, draw two cards instead.

editions.flavor: Knowledge fills the mind of a fool and opens the mind of the sage.
Knowledge fills the mind of a fool and opens the mind of the sage.

name: Thoughtrender Lamia
text: Constellation — Whenever Thoughtrender Lamia or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, each opponent discards a card.

editions.flavor: Some predators can sense fear in their prey, but the lamia is drawn to madness.

name: Thought Scour
text:
Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"As you inject the viscus vitae into the brain stem, don't let the spastic moaning bother you. It will soon become music to your ears."

"As you inject the viscus vitae into the brain stem, don't let the spastic moaning bother you. It will soon become music to your ears."
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Thoughtseize
text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card. You lose 2 life.

editions.flavor: "Any dream is a robust harvest. Still, I prefer the timeworn dreams, heavy with import, that haunt the obsessive mind."

"Knowledge is such a burden. Release it. Release all your fears to me."
—Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver

name: Thoughts of Ruin
text: Each player sacrifices a land for each card in your hand.

editions.flavor:
"In our war with the kami, we annihilate what is our own. Do they too suffer ruination in their hidden world?"
—Diary of Azusa

text:
You have no maximum hand size.

editions.flavor: Infinite possibilities contained in a finite space.

text:
You may activate abilities of creatures you control as though those creatures had haste.

text:
{T}: Create a 1/1 white Human creature token.

editions.flavor: "Swarms of the unhallowed claw at Thraben's gates! Do you still deny the end approaches?"

name: Thraben Foulbloods

name: Thraben Gargoyle
text:
Defender

name: Thraben Heretic
text: {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard.

"Let them decry me for burning the dead. I'm not giving those ghoulcallers any more fuel for their madness."

name: Thraben Inspector
text: When Thraben Inspector enters the battlefield, investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")

editions.flavor: "If you've been at this as long as I have, nothing can surprise you. That's the hope, at least."

name: Thraben Militia
text: Trample

editions.flavor: "The time for grief is over. The time for retribution has begun."

—Hinrik of House Cecani

text:
Vigilance
Whenever another creature you control dies, you may transform Thraben Sentry.

editions.flavor: "Looks like it's going to be a quiet night."

text: Vigilance

name: Thran Forge
text: {2}: Until end of turn, target nonartifact creature gets +1/+0 and becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.

editions.flavor: "This will work," Gerrard called to the elves as he used the forge to strengthen the aboroth, "but if it doesn't, we won't survive to care."

name: Thran Foundry
text: {1}, {T}, Exile Thran Foundry: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

editions.flavor:
"What we do not use up, we use again."
—Urza

name: Thran Golem
text: As long as Thran Golem is enchanted, it gets +2/+2 and has flying, first strike, and trample.

editions.flavor: The golems of the ancient Thran still draw power in ways that baffle the artificers of today.
As a beaver's teeth grow unchecked without regular use, so does the golem's armor grow without regular battles.
The golems of the ancient Thran still draw power in ways that baffle the artificers of today.
Karn felt more secure about his value to Urza when he realized he didn't need regular trimming.
The golems of the ancient Thran still draw power in ways that baffle the artificers of today.

name: Thran Lens
text: All permanents are colorless.

editions.flavor:
"Every device in the rig is evidence of Thran enlightenment. All mana was the same to them, whether from rock or water, growth or decay. Can you imagine such unity of vision?"
—Urza, journal

name: Thran Quarry
text:
At the beginning of the end step, if you control no creatures, sacrifice Thran Quarry.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Thran Tome
text: {5}, {T}: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Target opponent chooses one of those cards. Put that card into your graveyard, then draw two cards.

editions.flavor: Every line holds a tale, and between lie a thousand more.

name: Thran Turbine
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may add {C} or {C}{C} to your mana pool. You can't spend this mana to cast spells.

editions.flavor: When Urza asked the viashino what it did, they answered: "It hums."
